intro: Cohniella leptotifolia, commonly known as the slender-leaved cohniella, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Cohniella leptotifolia is adapted to grow in dry, sunny environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
